message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

This paper deals with the problem of repairing multiple failures in a distributed storage system, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several computer science subfields. The use of regenerating codes and graph-theoretic formulations suggests that the paper is likely to be categorized under cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The focus on storage systems and repair traffic reduction also suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) are possible categories. Finally, the use of cooperative repair codes and interference alignment codes suggests that cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) may also be a relevant subfield.
